fields.name: items
fields.description: Permissions that will be applied on the attached entity's subitems.

fields.name: self
fields.description:
A `self` grid applies to whatever entity this scoped ACL is applied to.

Its children will inherit other permissions based
on `collections` and `items` respectively.

types.name: AccessGrant
types.description:
An access grant is a combination of an Entity, a Role, and a Subject. It determines permissions for
said subject at the specific point in the hierarchy, and any child entities will inherit that role
as its accessControlList defines.

fields.name: entity
fields.description: The polymorphic entity to which access has been granted

fields.name: role
fields.description: The role the subject has been assigned

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The polymorphic subject that has been granted access

enumValues.description: Communities only

enumValues.name: ITEM
enumValues.description: Items only

(and all its children) has been granted.

occurrences on a specific day (or time interval).

types.name: AnyScalarProperty
types.description:
`AnyScalarProperty` represents a collection of known *scalar* properties. In effect,
it includes every possible schema property type except for groups (`GroupProperty`).

This union is intended to iterate the properties within a group. To iterate over the
properties in a `SchemaInstance`, you should use `AnySchemaPropertyType` to ensure that
you are also seeing groups.

Any object contained within this union is guaranteed to implement `ScalarProperty`
as well as `SchemaProperty`.

types.name: AnySchemaProperty
types.description:
`AnySchemaProperty` represents the top level of a schema instance's properties. It can include any scalar property, as
well as any `GroupProperty` that the instance might have. To query only scalar properties, see `AnyScalarProperty`.

All properties contained in this union are guaranteed to implement `SchemaProperty`.

types.name: AnySearchableProperty
types.description:
`AnySearchableProperty` represents a property that can be searched on.

Any property underneath this can be assured to implement `SearchableProperty`.

fields.name: array
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This describes whether or not the property's value
comes in an array rather than representing a discrete piece of information.

See `AssetsProperty`, `ContributorsProperty`, `MultiselectProperty`, and `TagsProperty`
for examples.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
A human-readable description for the property. It should describe the purpose of the
property as well as some details about the types of values it looks for.

It can be rendered as help text, hints, etc.

fields.name: fullPath
fields.description:
The full path that represents the property on the schema instance. It is guaranteed
to be unique for the instance, and can be used to grab a property directly, as well as
facilitating schema validation and errors within the admin application's forms.

fields.name: function
fields.description: The purpose or intent of this property relative to its entity, parents, and others.

fields.name: isWide
fields.description:
Whether to render a field as "wide" (two columns) in the form.
This is intended to help structure forms logically, as well as
provide ample space for certain types of data input, particularly
full-text, markdown, and other such complex fields.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Provided for introspection. This describes the underlying structure of the data type.

fields.name: label
fields.description: A human-readable label for the schema property.

fields.name: orderable
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. Whether this property can be used to order entities.
For certain data types, there's no sensible way to order properties.

fields.name: path
fields.description:
The "short" path for the property. For properties nested within a group, this can
be considered the name of the property without the group's prefix.

fields.name: required
fields.description:
Whether or not this property is required in order for the schema instance
to be considered valid.

Note: invalid data provided to a schema property will still invalidate
the instance as a whole—the required trait only determines whether a value
**must** be set.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This represents the actual data type this property
uses.

Rendering in the frontend should rely primarily on the `AnySchemaProperty` and
`AnyScalarProperty` unions (in that order)`, rather than relying on this value,
since the actual implementations of these properties differ in the GraphQL types
associated with their values.

types.name: AttachmentStorage
types.description: This describes where a given file attachment is stored (if at all)

enumValues.name: CACHE
enumValues.description:
CACHE refers to temporary storage. When a file is first uploaded to the system, it lives in cache and needs to be processed.
A user could potentially fetch something from an API while a file is still being processed in the background, and if so, none
of its derivatives will be present yet.

enumValues.name: DERIVATIVES
enumValues.description: Not yet used

enumValues.name: REMOTE
enumValues.description: Remote URL storage. Only used internally at present, but may sometimes appear during certain harvesting events.

enumValues.name: STORE
enumValues.description: STORE refers to permanent storage. An asset here has been fully processed and is ready for access

fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This describes whether or not the property's value
comes in an array rather than representing a discrete piece of information.

See `AssetsProperty`, `ContributorsProperty`, `MultiselectProperty`, and `TagsProperty`
for examples.

fields.name: fullPath
fields.description:
The full path that represents the property on the schema instance. It is guaranteed
to be unique for the instance, and can be used to grab a property directly, as well as
facilitating schema validation and errors within the admin application's forms.

fields.name: function
fields.description: The purpose or intent of this property relative to its entity, parents, and others.

fields.name: isWide
fields.description:
Whether to render a field as "wide" (two columns) in the form.
This is intended to help structure forms logically, as well as
provide ample space for certain types of data input, particularly
full-text, markdown, and other such complex fields.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Provided for introspection. This describes the underlying structure of the data type.

fields.name: orderable
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. Whether this property can be used to order entities.
For certain data types, there's no sensible way to order properties.

fields.name: path
fields.description:
The "short" path for the property. For properties nested within a group, this can
be considered the name of the property without the group's prefix.

fields.name: required
fields.description:
Whether or not this property is required in order for the schema instance
to be considered valid.

Note: invalid data provided to a schema property will still invalidate
the instance as a whole—the required trait only determines whether a value
**must** be set.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This represents the actual data type this property
uses.

Rendering in the frontend should rely primarily on the `AnySchemaProperty` and
`AnyScalarProperty` unions (in that order)`, rather than relying on this value,
since the actual implementations of these properties differ in the GraphQL types
associated with their values.

In practice, this means a `Collection` or an `Item`, not a `Community`.

types.name: Contributor
types.description:
An interface for an abstract contributor who has made a contribution.

See `kind` for what type it is.

This type differentiates from `Contributor` in that it lacks the ability to grab contributions,
in order to prevent inordinately long nesting in GQL fetches in certain situations.

fields.name: affiliation
fields.description: Only applicable when `kind` = `PERSON`.

fields.description: The total number of collection contributions from this contributor.

enumValues.description: Sort contributors by affiliation A-Z, then fall back to name A-Z

enumValues.name: MOST_CONTRIBUTIONS

enumValues.description: Sort contributors by name A-Z. For people, this currently uses western naming order (family name, given name).

enumValues.name: NAME_DESCENDING
enumValues.description: Sort contributors by name Z-A. For people, this currently uses western naming order (family name, given name).

enumValues.description: Sort contributors by oldest created date

enumValues.name: RECENT
enumValues.description: Sort contributors by newest created date

types.name: DateEqualsOperatorInput
types.description: Require that `path = value` while enforcing that value is a date.

types.name: DateFilterInput
types.description: A date-filter for various analytics and other resolvers.

inputFields.name: endDate
inputFields.description:
The end date. Make sure it is >= `start_date` if provided.

For actual filtering, this will get turned into 23:59:59 in the provided `time_zone`.

inputFields.name: startDate
inputFields.description:
The start date. Make sure it is <= `end_date` if provided.

For actual filtering, this will get turned into midnight in the provided `time_zone`.

inputFields.name: timeZone
inputFields.description:
The time zone to use for calculating the range.

If not provided, it will use the server's configured default,
which is at present UTC, but may be configurable later on.

types.name: DateGTEOperatorInput
types.description: Require that `path ≥ value` while enforcing that value is a date.

types.name: DateLTEOperatorInput
types.description: Require that `path ≤ value` while enforcing that value is a date.

types.name: DatePrecision
types.description: This describes the level of precision a VariablePrecisionDate has, in increasing order of specificity.

fields.name: array
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This describes whether or not the property's value
comes in an array rather than representing a discrete piece of information.

See `AssetsProperty`, `ContributorsProperty`, `MultiselectProperty`, and `TagsProperty`
for examples.

fields.name: fullPath
fields.description:
The full path that represents the property on the schema instance. It is guaranteed
to be unique for the instance, and can be used to grab a property directly, as well as
facilitating schema validation and errors within the admin application's forms.

fields.name: function
fields.description: The purpose or intent of this property relative to its entity, parents, and others.

fields.name: isWide
fields.description:
Whether to render a field as "wide" (two columns) in the form.
This is intended to help structure forms logically, as well as
provide ample space for certain types of data input, particularly
full-text, markdown, and other such complex fields.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Provided for introspection. This describes the underlying structure of the data type.

fields.name: orderable
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. Whether this property can be used to order entities.
For certain data types, there's no sensible way to order properties.

fields.name: path
fields.description:
The "short" path for the property. For properties nested within a group, this can
be considered the name of the property without the group's prefix.

fields.name: required
fields.description:
Whether or not this property is required in order for the schema instance
to be considered valid.

Note: invalid data provided to a schema property will still invalidate
the instance as a whole—the required trait only determines whether a value
**must** be set.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This represents the actual data type this property
uses.

Rendering in the frontend should rely primarily on the `AnySchemaProperty` and
`AnyScalarProperty` unions (in that order)`, rather than relying on this value,
since the actual implementations of these properties differ in the GraphQL types
associated with their values.

types.name: DescendantListBackground
types.description: An enumerated value associated with the templating subsystem.

enumValues.name: DARK
enumValues.description: A dark gradient is applied to the background of this template.

enumValues.name: LIGHT
enumValues.description: A light gradient is applied to the background of this template.

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: No background is applied to this template.

types.name: DescendantListSelectionMode
types.description: An enumerated value associated with the templating subsystem.

enumValues.name: DYNAMIC
enumValues.description: Render descendants from a dynamic ordering, determined at query time.

enumValues.name: MANUAL
enumValues.description: Render descendants from a manual ordering set on each individual entity. See `manualListName` for how this works.

enumValues.name: NAMED
enumValues.description: Render descendants from a named ordering that exists on the source entity.

enumValues.name: PROPERTY
enumValues.description: Render entities from a schema property on the source entity.

fields.name: background
fields.description: The background gradient to use for this template. Affects presentation.

fields.name: dynamicOrderingDefinition
fields.description:
When `selectionMode` is set to `DYNAMIC`, this uses the same basic structure
as schemas to define a dynamic ordering that is resolved at runtime and based
on the `selectionSource`.

fields.name: manualListName
fields.description:
When `selectionMode` is set to `MANUAL`, the purpose of this property
is to specify a name under which all the manual selections (per entity)
will be stored. This allows a layout to have multiple templates of the
same type using different lists, that will persist across rearrangements
of the layout _without_ losing connections between entities.

fields.name: orderingIdentifier
fields.description:
When `selectionMode` is set to `NAMED`, this will look up the named ordering
on the resolved `selectionSource` and render up to `selectionLimit` entities.

fields.name: seeAllOrderingIdentifier
fields.description:
If provided, this will expose an ordering on the template instance that can
be used to generate a link to the ordering in the frontend.

fields.name: selectionFallbackMode
fields.description:
The fallback mode to use when rendering a list of entities, when the list from
`selectionMode` is empty and `useSelectionFallback` has been set to true.

fields.name: selectionLimit
fields.description:
Regardless of `selectionMode`, this limit will be applied on whatever resulting
list of entities are produced, so that only up to that amount of entities are
rendered in the template proper.

fields.name: selectionMode
fields.description:
The default mode to use when rendering a list of entities.

See also `selectionFallbackMode` and `useSelectionFallback`.

fields.name: selectionPropertyPath
fields.description:
When `selectionMode` is set to `PROPERTY`, this should be set to the full path
for a given schema property on the associated `selectionSource`

fields.name: selectionSource
fields.description:
When selecting entities based on `selectionMode`, this property determines
which entity (relevant to the rendering entity) should be used for lookups.

By default, it is `self`, which means the rendering entity itself.

It can also support things like `ancestor.journal`, `ancestor.issue`, etc.,
in order to render a list of values in its parent.

fields.name: selectionSourceAncestorName
fields.description:
The derived name of the ancestor used for the `selectionSource`.

Exposed for introspection only.

fields.name: selectionSourceMode
fields.description:
An enum representing what mode `selectionSource` is in. Not directly set,
it is used internally for lookups.

fields.name: showContributors
fields.description: Show contributors when listing entities.

fields.name: showEntityContext
fields.description: Show additional context about each entity in the selection.

fields.name: showNestedEntities
fields.description:
Show nested items from the associated listItemLayouts in order to generate
a two-tier list.

fields.name: slots
fields.description: Slot definitions for this template.

fields.name: useSelectionFallback
fields.description:
Controls whether or not to use `selectionFallbackMode` if the entity list returned
via `selectionMode` turns out to be empty at runtime.

fields.name: variant
fields.description: The variant rendering mode to use for this template. Affects presentation.

fields.name: width
fields.description:
This controls how wide the template should render.

**Note**: When using `HALF`, you should take care to make sure that there is an adjacent
template that also uses `HALF`.

types.description: Slot definitions for the associated template.

fields.description: The ordering to render for a "see all" link.

enumValues.name: PUBLISHED_ASCENDING
enumValues.description: Sort descendants by oldest published date (or OLDEST for communities)

enumValues.name: PUBLISHED_DESCENDING
enumValues.description: Sort descendants by newest published date (or RECENT for communities)

enumValues.name: TITLE_ASCENDING
enumValues.description: Sort descendants by title A-Z

enumValues.name: TITLE_DESCENDING
enumValues.description: Sort descendants by title Z-A

types.name: EntityDescendantScopeFilter
types.description:
This enum is used to filter the type(s) of descendants to include
in a set of results.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: This will include anything regardless of type.

enumValues.name: ANY_ENTITY
enumValues.description: This will include all `Collection`s and `Item`s that are direct descendants and not linked.

enumValues.name: ANY_LINK
enumValues.description: This will include any _linked_ `Collection`s or `Item`s.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION
enumValues.description: This will include only directly descending `Collection`s, no links.

enumValues.name: COLLECTION_OR_LINK
enumValues.description: This will include any descendant `Collection`s, whether or not it is a link.

enumValues.name: ITEM
enumValues.description: This will include only directly descending `Item`s, no links.

enumValues.name: ITEM_OR_LINK
enumValues.description: This will include any descendant `Item`s, whether or not it is a link.

enumValues.name: LINKED_COLLECTION
enumValues.description: This will only descendant `Collection`s that are linked.

enumValues.name: LINKED_ITEM
enumValues.description: This will only descendant `Item`s that are linked.

fields.name: array
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This describes whether or not the property's value
comes in an array rather than representing a discrete piece of information.

See `AssetsProperty`, `ContributorsProperty`, `MultiselectProperty`, and `TagsProperty`
for examples.

fields.name: availableEntities
fields.description: Expose all available entities for this schema property.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
A human-readable description for the property. It should describe the purpose of the
property as well as some details about the types of values it looks for.

It can be rendered as help text, hints, etc.

fields.name: entity
fields.description: A single reference to another entity within the system.

fields.name: fullPath
fields.description:
The full path that represents the property on the schema instance. It is guaranteed
to be unique for the instance, and can be used to grab a property directly, as well as
facilitating schema validation and errors within the admin application's forms.

fields.name: function
fields.description: The purpose or intent of this property relative to its entity, parents, and others.

fields.name: isWide
fields.description:
Whether to render a field as "wide" (two columns) in the form.
This is intended to help structure forms logically, as well as
provide ample space for certain types of data input, particularly
full-text, markdown, and other such complex fields.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Provided for introspection. This describes the underlying structure of the data type.

fields.name: label
fields.description: A human-readable label for the schema property.

fields.name: orderable
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. Whether this property can be used to order entities.
For certain data types, there's no sensible way to order properties.

fields.name: path
fields.description:
The "short" path for the property. For properties nested within a group, this can
be considered the name of the property without the group's prefix.

fields.name: required
fields.description:
Whether or not this property is required in order for the schema instance
to be considered valid.

Note: invalid data provided to a schema property will still invalidate
the instance as a whole—the required trait only determines whether a value
**must** be set.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This represents the actual data type this property
uses.

Rendering in the frontend should rely primarily on the `AnySchemaProperty` and
`AnyScalarProperty` unions (in that order)`, rather than relying on this value,
since the actual implementations of these properties differ in the GraphQL types
associated with their values.

for examples.

fields.name: fullPath
fields.description:
The full path that represents the property on the schema instance. It is guaranteed
to be unique for the instance, and can be used to grab a property directly, as well as
facilitating schema validation and errors within the admin application's forms.

fields.name: function

This is intended to help structure forms logically, as well as
provide ample space for certain types of data input, particularly
full-text, markdown, and other such complex fields.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Provided for introspection. This describes the underlying structure of the data type.

fields.name: orderable
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. Whether this property can be used to order entities.
For certain data types, there's no sensible way to order properties.

fields.name: path
fields.description:
The "short" path for the property. For properties nested within a group, this can
be considered the name of the property without the group's prefix.

fields.name: required
fields.description:
Whether or not this property is required in order for the schema instance
to be considered valid.

Note: invalid data provided to a schema property will still invalidate
the instance as a whole—the required trait only determines whether a value
**must** be set.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This represents the actual data type this property
uses.

Rendering in the frontend should rely primarily on the `AnySchemaProperty` and
`AnyScalarProperty` unions (in that order)`, rather than relying on this value,
since the actual implementations of these properties differ in the GraphQL types
associated with their values.

fields.name: namedAncestors
fields.description:
Fetch a list of named ancestors for this entity. This list is deterministically sorted
to retrieve the "closest" ancestors first, ascending upwards in the hierarchy from there.

**Note**: Like breadcrumbs, this association is intentionally not paginated for ease of use,
because in practice a schema should not have many associations.

types.name: LayoutDefinition
types.description:
Entities within the system have layouts associated with their schema,
that can eventually be overridden for more custom approaches.

This interface defines the *definition* for one such layout, while any
given entity will also have its own LayoutInstance.

types.name: LayoutInstance
types.description: An interface describing an instance type that can be rendered for a given entity.

fields.name: entity
fields.description: The associated entity for this layout instance.

fields.name: lastRenderedAt
fields.description: The time this object was last rendered.

types.name: LayoutKind
types.description: The various kinds of `Layout`s in the system.

enumValues.name: HERO
enumValues.description: The "hero" layout for an Entity.

enumValues.name: LIST_ITEM
enumValues.description: A layout describing how an entity should look when it is being rendered.

enumValues.name: MAIN
enumValues.description:
The "main" layout for the landing page of an entity.

It is where most of the detail on an entity should go.

enumValues.name: METADATA
enumValues.description: A layout for controlling how metadata should render.

enumValues.name: NAVIGATION
enumValues.description: A layout describing how an entity should be navigated.

enumValues.name: SUPPLEMENTARY
enumValues.description: A shared layout for certain supplementary routes like contributors and metrics.

types.name: LinkListBackground
types.description: An enumerated value associated with the templating subsystem.

enumValues.name: DARK
enumValues.description: A dark gradient is applied to the background of this template.

enumValues.name: LIGHT
enumValues.description: A light gradient is applied to the background of this template.

enumValues.name: NONE
enumValues.description: No background is applied to this template.

types.name: LinkListSelectionMode
types.description: An enumerated value associated with the templating subsystem.

enumValues.name: DYNAMIC
enumValues.description: Render links from a dynamic list, determined at query time.

enumValues.name: MANUAL
enumValues.description: Render links from a manual list set on each individual entity. See `manualListName` for how this works.

fields.name: background
fields.description: The background gradient to use for this template. Affects presentation.

fields.name: dynamicOrderingDefinition
fields.description:
When `selectionMode` is set to `DYNAMIC`, this uses the same basic structure
as schemas to define a dynamic ordering that is resolved at runtime and based
on the `selectionSource`.

fields.name: manualListName
fields.description:
When `selectionMode` is set to `MANUAL`, the purpose of this property
is to specify a name under which all the manual selections (per entity)
will be stored. This allows a layout to have multiple templates of the
same type using different lists, that will persist across rearrangements
of the layout _without_ losing connections between entities.

fields.name: seeAllOrderingIdentifier
fields.description:
If provided, this will expose an ordering on the template instance that can
be used to generate a link to the ordering in the frontend.

fields.name: selectionFallbackMode
fields.description:
The fallback mode to use when rendering a list of entities, when the list from
`selectionMode` is empty and `useSelectionFallback` has been set to true.

fields.name: selectionLimit
fields.description:
Regardless of `selectionMode`, this limit will be applied on whatever resulting
list of entities are produced, so that only up to that amount of entities are
rendered in the template proper.

fields.name: selectionMode
fields.description:
The default mode to use when rendering a list of entities.

See also `selectionFallbackMode` and `useSelectionFallback`.

fields.name: selectionSource
fields.description:
When selecting entities based on `selectionMode`, this property determines
which entity (relevant to the rendering entity) should be used for lookups.

By default, it is `self`, which means the rendering entity itself.

It can also support things like `ancestor.journal`, `ancestor.issue`, etc.,
in order to render a list of values in its parent.

fields.name: selectionSourceAncestorName
fields.description:
The derived name of the ancestor used for the `selectionSource`.

Exposed for introspection only.

fields.name: selectionSourceMode
fields.description:
An enum representing what mode `selectionSource` is in. Not directly set,
it is used internally for lookups.

fields.name: showContributors
fields.description: Show contributors when listing entities.

fields.name: showEntityContext
fields.description: Show additional context about each entity in the selection.

fields.name: showNestedEntities
fields.description:
Show nested items from the associated listItemLayouts in order to generate
a two-tier list.

fields.name: slots
fields.description: Slot definitions for this template.

fields.name: useSelectionFallback
fields.description:
Controls whether or not to use `selectionFallbackMode` if the entity list returned
via `selectionMode` turns out to be empty at runtime.

fields.name: variant
fields.description: The variant rendering mode to use for this template. Affects presentation.

fields.name: width
fields.description:
This controls how wide the template should render.

**Note**: When using `HALF`, you should take care to make sure that there is an adjacent
template that also uses `HALF`.

types.description: Slot definitions for the associated template.

fields.description:
Whether this template instance should be hidden based on some logic.

fields.description: The time this object was last rendered.

fields.name: seeAllOrdering
fields.description: The ordering to render for a "see all" link.

fields.description: Rendered slots for this template.

fields.name: array
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This describes whether or not the property's value
comes in an array rather than representing a discrete piece of information.

See `AssetsProperty`, `ContributorsProperty`, `MultiselectProperty`, and `TagsProperty`
for examples.

fields.name: fullPath
fields.description:
The full path that represents the property on the schema instance. It is guaranteed
to be unique for the instance, and can be used to grab a property directly, as well as
facilitating schema validation and errors within the admin application's forms.

fields.name: function
fields.description: The purpose or intent of this property relative to its entity, parents, and others.

fields.name: isWide
fields.description:
Whether to render a field as "wide" (two columns) in the form.
This is intended to help structure forms logically, as well as
provide ample space for certain types of data input, particularly
full-text, markdown, and other such complex fields.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Provided for introspection. This describes the underlying structure of the data type.

fields.name: orderable
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. Whether this property can be used to order entities.
For certain data types, there's no sensible way to order properties.

fields.name: path
fields.description:
The "short" path for the property. For properties nested within a group, this can
be considered the name of the property without the group's prefix.

fields.name: required
fields.description:
Whether or not this property is required in order for the schema instance
to be considered valid.

Note: invalid data provided to a schema property will still invalidate
the instance as a whole—the required trait only determines whether a value
**must** be set.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This represents the actual data type this property
uses.

Rendering in the frontend should rely primarily on the `AnySchemaProperty` and
`AnyScalarProperty` unions (in that order)`, rather than relying on this value,
since the actual implementations of these properties differ in the GraphQL types
associated with their values.

types.name: MatchesOperatorInput
types.description:
Use full-text search on `path` to match `value`.

As with top-level query searches, basic quoting and similar features are supported. See
[websearch_to_tsquery](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/textsearch-controls.html) for
more information.

types.name: NamedAncestor
types.description:
Entity schemas can define named ancestors, which allows UI developers to refer
authoritatively to significant relatives in an entity's ancestor. This object
represents the connection between an originating entity and its ancestors,
should any be defined for the schema.

fields.name: ancestor
fields.description: The actual ancestor

fields.name: ancestorDepth
fields.description: The depth of the ancestor in the hierarchy

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the ancestor. Guaranteed to be unique for this specific entity.

fields.name: originDepth
fields.description: The relative depth of the originating entity

fields.name: relativeDepth
fields.description:
The relative depth from the source entity to its ancestor. In other words, `(origin_depth - ancestor_depth)`.
Used for sorting ancestors deterministically.

types.name: Ordering
types.description: An ordering that belongs to an entity and arranges its children in a pre-configured way

args.name: after
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come after the specified cursor.

args.name: before
args.description: Returns the elements in the list that come before the specified cursor.

args.name: first
args.description: Returns the first _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: last
args.description: Returns the last _n_ elements from the list.

args.name: order
args.description:
You can specify the direction to retrieve entries for an ordering.
INVERSE will be identical to DEFAULT if the ordering is marked constant.

args.name: page
args.description: The page of edges/nodes to fetch

args.name: pageDirection
args.description: The direction in which pages advance (to traverse pages backwards)

args.name: perPage
args.description: The amount of edges / nodes to fetch per page

fields.name: constant
fields.description: A constant ordering should be treated as not being able to invert itself.

fields.name: count
fields.description: The number of entries currently visible within the ordering

fields.name: disabled
fields.description: Whether the ordering has been disabled—orderings inherited from schemas will be disabled if deleted.

fields.name: disabledAt
fields.description: The time the ordering was disabled, if applicable

fields.name: entity
fields.description: The entity that owns the ordering

fields.name: footer
fields.description: Optional markdown content to render after the children

fields.name: header
fields.description: Optional markdown content to render before the children

fields.name: hidden
fields.description:
A hidden ordering represents an ordering that should not be shown in the frontend,
when iterating over an entity's available orderings. It does not affect access, as
hidden orderings may still serve a functional purpose for their schema.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: A unique identifier for the ordering within the context of its parent entity.

fields.name: inheritedFromSchema
fields.description: Whether the ordering was inherited from its entity's schema definition

fields.name: initial
fields.description: Whether this ordering serves as the initial ordering for its parent entity

fields.name: name
fields.description: An optional, human-readable name for the ordering

fields.name: pristine
fields.description:
For orderings that are `inheritedFromSchema`, this tracks whether or not the
entity has been modified from the schema's definition. It is always false
for custom, user-created orderings.

fields.name: render
fields.description: Configuration for how to render an ordering and its entries.

fields.name: tree
fields.description:
A tree ordering has some special handling to return entities
in deterministic order based on their hierarchical position
and relation to other entities in the same ordering.

This is effectively a shortcut for `Ordering.render.mode === "TREE"`.

types.name: OrderingAvailabilityFilter
types.description: An ordering's availability refers to it being enabled or disabled.

enumValues.name: ALL
enumValues.description: Do not filter orderings by whether they are enabled or disabled.

enumValues.name: DISABLED
enumValues.description: Fetch only *disabled* orderings.

enumValues.name: ENABLED
enumValues.description: Fetch only *enabled* orderings.

types.name: OrderingEntry
types.description: An entry within an ordering, it can refer to an entity or an entity link

fields.name: ancestors
fields.description:
When the associated `Ordering` is a `TREE`, and the current entry is a leaf, this array can be used
to get the associated ancestors within the entry that

fields.name: entry
fields.description:
The actual element being ordered. At present, this will only be a `Community`, `Collection`, or `Item`,
but future implementations of orderings may include other content, such as presentation elements.

fields.name: entrySlug
fields.description:
The delegated `slug` from the associated `entry`.

This can be null because future entries may not implement it.

fields.name: entryTitle
fields.description:
The delegated `title` from the associated `entry`.

This can be null because future entries may not implement it.

fields.name: nextSibling
fields.description: The next entry in the current ordering, if one exists. This will be null if this entry is the last.

fields.name: ordering
fields.description: The parent ordering

fields.name: position
fields.description: The 1-based position of this entry.

fields.name: prevSibling
fields.description: The previous entry in the current ordering, if one exists. This will be null if this entry is the first.

fields.name: relativeDepth
fields.description: A calculation of the depth of an entry in the hierarchy, relative to the ordering's owning entity.

fields.name: treeDepth
fields.description:
When an ordering's render mode is set to TREE, its entries will have this set.
It is a normalized depth based on what other entities were accepted into the ordering.

enumValues.name: INVERSE
enumValues.description: Retrieve the ordering entries in an inverted order, accounting for paths

A collection of settings for filtering what appears what entities
may populate an ordering. At present, this only supports schemas.

fields.name: schemas
fields.description:
If set, any child or descendant that matches one of these schemas will
be availabel to be included in the ordering.

types.name: OrderingFilterDefinitionInput
types.description:
A collection of settings for filtering what appears what entities
may populate an ordering. At present, this only supports schemas.

inputFields.name: schemas
inputFields.description:
If set, any child or descendant that matches one of these schemas will
be availabel to be included in the ordering.

types.name: OrderingOrder
types.description: An enum used to order `Ordering`s. It uses `DETERMINISTIC` by default to ensure a consistent rendering experience.

enumValues.name: DETERMINISTIC
enumValues.description: Sort orderings by their static position of the ordering, falling back to the name if unset.

enumValues.name: OLDEST
enumValues.description: Sort orderings by oldest created date

enumValues.name: RECENT
enumValues.description: Sort orderings by newest created date

types.name: OrderingPath
types.description: This represents a valid path that can be used for orderings.

fields.name: description
fields.description: A helpful description of the path

fields.name: grouping
fields.description: A logical grouping for ordering paths

fields.name: label
fields.description: A human-readable label for the path

fields.name: labelPrefix
fields.description: Some paths may have a prefix. For instance, schema properties will have the name of the schema.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The exact path that should be provided to mutation inputs.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The schema property type

types.name: OrderingPathGrouping
types.description: A logical grouping for ordering paths.

enumValues.name: ENTITY
enumValues.description: Static properties that are directly on an entity.

enumValues.name: LINK
enumValues.description: Static properties that are derived from a link.

enumValues.name: PROPS
enumValues.description:
Paths under this type come from a schema. Not every entity is guaranteed
to have one, and in orderings with mixed entities, missing props will be
treated as null.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Static properties that are derived from a schema.

types.name: OrderingRenderDefinition
types.description: Configuration for controlling how an ordering renders itself and its entries.

fields.name: mode
fields.description: How to render entries within

types.name: OrderingRenderDefinitionInput
types.description: Describe how an ordering should render its entries.

types.name: OrderingRenderMode
types.description: How entries in an ordering should be rendered.

enumValues.name: FLAT
enumValues.description:
The default for most orderings. Every ordering is considered to be on
the same level of the hierarchy, and positions are calculated based
solely on the paths.

enumValues.name: TREE
enumValues.description:
A special mode for handling orderings that should operate like a tree. In this setting,
entries will be calculated first as though they were flat, then analyzed in order to
adjust the positioning to account for the entry's ancestors and position relative to
other entries in the ordering.

types.name: OrderingSchemaFilter
types.description: This defines a specific schema that an ordering can filter its entries by

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: The identifier within the namespace for the schema.

fields.name: namespace
fields.description: The namespace the schema occupies.

fields.name: version
fields.description: An optional version requirement for the associated schema.

types.name: OrderingSchemaFilterInput
types.description: This defines a specific schema that an ordering can filter its entries by

inputFields.name: identifier
inputFields.description: The identifier within the namespace for the schema.

inputFields.name: namespace
inputFields.description: The namespace the schema occupies.

inputFields.name: version
inputFields.description:
An optional version requirement for this ordering. It supports
Ruby's version declaration syntax, so you can provide a value
like `">= 1.2"` to match against semantically-versioned schemas.

types.name: OrderingSelectDefinition
types.description: Defines how an ordering should select its entries.

types.name: OrderingSelectDefinitionInput
types.description: Define how an ordering should select its entries

types.name: OrderingSelectLinkDefinition
types.description: Describes how an ordering should select its links.

types.name: OrderingSelectLinkDefinitionInput
types.description: Describe how an ordering should select its links.

fields.name: background
fields.description: The background gradient to use for this template. Affects presentation.

fields.name: orderingIdentifier
fields.description:
The identifier for the ordering to derive next/prev siblings from.

Refer to `orderingSource` and `selectionSource` for more details.

fields.name: orderingSource
fields.description:
A reference to the entity that contains an ordering identified by `orderingIdentifier`.
It operates exactly like `selectionSource`. See that property for more documentation.

**Note**: While `self` is allowed here, it only makes sense if the rendering entity
is contained in one of its own orderings, which doesn't happen normally. The template
will still render, but it likely won't find siblings.

fields.name: selectionSource
fields.description:
What entity to use for detecting the positional prev/next siblings.

By default, it is `self`. However, it can be overridden for creating templates that
navigate through parent issues, volumes, journals, etc. For instance, an article could
create an `<ordering />` template that has the following properties set:

* `selectionSource`: `"ancestors.issue"`
* `orderingSource`: `"ancestors.journal"`
* `orderingIdentifier`: `"issues"`

This would use the _journal's_ `issues` ordering to navigate through the article's
associated `issues`, and provide a quick way to navigate through varying levels of
the upper hierarchy from lower points in the tree.

fields.name: selectionSourceAncestorName
fields.description:
The derived name of the ancestor used for the `selectionSource`.

Exposed for introspection only.

fields.name: selectionSourceMode
fields.description:
An enum representing what mode `selectionSource` is in. Not directly set,
it is used internally for lookups.

fields.name: slots
fields.description: Slot definitions for this template.

fields.name: width
fields.description:
This controls how wide the template should render.

**Note**: When using `HALF`, you should take care to make sure that there is an adjacent
template that also uses `HALF`.

types.name: Role
types.description: A named role in the WDP API

fields.name: accessControlList
fields.description: The access control list for this specific role

fields.name: allowedActions
fields.description: A list of action names that have been granted to this role

fields.name: customPriority
fields.description: Only relevant for `custom` roles, this affects sorting.

fields.name: effectiveAccess
fields.description: User-specific access permissions for this object.

fields.name: globalAccessControlList
fields.description: The global access control list that this assigned role implies, based on its sort order.

fields.name: globalAllowedActions
fields.description: A list of global action names that this role implies, based on its sort order.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description:
For `system` roles, this will be populated with the unique identifier
that marks this as a system role.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The specific kind of role this is, based on how it entered the WDP-API.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The human readable name of the role within the system

fields.name: permissions
fields.description:
Surfaced from the accessControlList for convenience, these are returned as
an array that allows a user to check for the state of all possible roles
without having to specify them explicitly in the GraphQL request

fields.name: primacy
fields.description:
Used internally to sort roles and ensure certain role types are above
and below others, irrespective of priority.

fields.name: priority
fields.description:
The calculated sort priority for this role.

* For `custom` roles, it is based on `custom_priority`.
* For `system` roles, it is based on hard-coded values within the system
  and cannot be modified.

fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.description: The item at the end of the edge.

types.name: RoleKind
types.description: A categorization of a `Role` based on how it gets into the WDP-API.

enumValues.name: CUSTOM
enumValues.description: Custom roles are created and managed through the `createRole`, `updateRole`, and `destroyRole` mutations.

enumValues.name: SYSTEM
enumValues.description: System roles are shipped by default with WDP-API and cannot be modified.

types.name: RoleOrder
types.description: Sort roles by a specific property and order

enumValues.name: DEFAULT
enumValues.description: Sort roles by default priority within the system

enumValues.name: NAME_ASCENDING
enumValues.description: Sort roles by their name A-Z

enumValues.name: NAME_DESCENDING
enumValues.description: Sort roles by their name Z-A

enumValues.name: OLDEST
enumValues.description: Sort roles by oldest created date

enumValues.name: RECENT
enumValues.description: Sort roles by newest created date

types.name: RolePrimacy
types.description: The level of importance any given role has when it comes to determing what a user's "primary" role is.

enumValues.name: DEFAULT
enumValues.description: Values with this primacy level are the default. Any custom roles will be in this scope.

enumValues.name: HIGH
enumValues.description: Values with this primacy level take priority over all others. They cannot be directly assigned through the API.

enumValues.name: LOW
enumValues.description: Values with this primacy level are always sorted after every other role.

types.name: RoleSystemIdentifier
types.description: This will identify _which_ `system` role this is, if applicable. See `RoleKind` for more information.

enumValues.name: ADMIN
enumValues.description: A global administrator. This role cannot be directly assigned.

enumValues.name: EDITOR
enumValues.description: An editor has basic update permissions for a specific point in the hierarchy.

enumValues.name: MANAGER
enumValues.description:
A manager can be assigned to handle most `Community` and other entity management concerns.

They can also appoint other roles (except for other managers) to any entity they manage.

enumValues.name: READER
enumValues.description:
A reader is anyone who has been given explicit read-access to an entity.
This role is primarily used by the administration UI.

**Note**: Anonymous users can still view public entities in the frontend.

types.name: ScalarProperty
types.description: A property on a `SchemaInstance`.

fields.name: array
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This describes whether or not the property's value
comes in an array rather than representing a discrete piece of information.

See `AssetsProperty`, `ContributorsProperty`, `MultiselectProperty`, and `TagsProperty`
for examples.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
A human-readable description for the property. It should describe the purpose of the
property as well as some details about the types of values it looks for.

It can be rendered as help text, hints, etc.

fields.name: fullPath
fields.description:
The full path that represents the property on the schema instance. It is guaranteed
to be unique for the instance, and can be used to grab a property directly, as well as
facilitating schema validation and errors within the admin application's forms.

fields.name: function
fields.description: The purpose or intent of this property relative to its entity, parents, and others.

fields.name: isWide
fields.description:
Whether to render a field as "wide" (two columns) in the form.
This is intended to help structure forms logically, as well as
provide ample space for certain types of data input, particularly
full-text, markdown, and other such complex fields.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Provided for introspection. This describes the underlying structure of the data type.

fields.name: label
fields.description: A human-readable label for the schema property.

fields.name: orderable
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. Whether this property can be used to order entities.
For certain data types, there's no sensible way to order properties.

fields.name: path
fields.description:
The "short" path for the property. For properties nested within a group, this can
be considered the name of the property without the group's prefix.

fields.name: required
fields.description:
Whether or not this property is required in order for the schema instance
to be considered valid.

Note: invalid data provided to a schema property will still invalidate
the instance as a whole—the required trait only determines whether a value
**must** be set.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This represents the actual data type this property
uses.

Rendering in the frontend should rely primarily on the `AnySchemaProperty` and
`AnyScalarProperty` unions (in that order)`, rather than relying on this value,
since the actual implementations of these properties differ in the GraphQL types
associated with their values.

types.name: SchemaComponent
types.description:
A string primitive with a very constrained format, representing components
of a schema like namespaces, identifiers, ordering names, etc.

It is also used in the templating subsystem.

It corresponds to the regular expression `(?-mix:\A[a-z][a-z0-9_]*?[a-z0-9]\z)`.

types.name: SchemaDefinition
types.description:
A schema definition is a logical grouping of `SchemaVersion`s that identifies
only the shared kind, namespace, and identifier. The name is also most likely
shared, although it can change between schema versions, and the value on the
definition will default to whatever the most recent version uses.

comes in an array rather than representing a discrete piece of information.

See `AssetsProperty`, `ContributorsProperty`, `MultiselectProperty`, and `TagsProperty`
for examples.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
A human-readable description for the property. It should describe the purpose of the
property as well as some details about the types of values it looks for.

It can be rendered as help text, hints, etc.

fields.name: fullPath
fields.description:
The full path that represents the property on the schema instance. It is guaranteed
to be unique for the instance, and can be used to grab a property directly, as well as
facilitating schema validation and errors within the admin application's forms.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: Provided for introspection. This describes the underlying structure of the data type.

fields.name: orderable
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. Whether this property can be used to order entities.
For certain data types, there's no sensible way to order properties.

fields.name: path
fields.description:
The "short" path for the property. For properties nested within a group, this can
be considered the name of the property without the group's prefix.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Provided for introspection. This represents the actual data type this property
uses.

Rendering in the frontend should rely primarily on the `AnySchemaProperty` and
`AnyScalarProperty` unions (in that order)`, rather than relying on this value,
since the actual implementations of these properties differ in the GraphQL types
associated with their values.

types.name: SchemaPropertyFunction
types.description: Schema properties can serve various functions. This helps communicate the purpose of them, for building UIs, and general introspection.

enumValues.name: CONTENT
enumValues.description: This property acts as data inherently representative of the entity. Full text of an article, titling, and other such purposes.

enumValues.name: METADATA
enumValues.description:
This property is intended to offer further information about the content, but not necessarily the content itself.
Most metadata should be things that are filterable or searchable to help users find and learn more about related
content.

enumValues.name: PRESENTATION
enumValues.description:
This property is used for presenting information *about* the content, or how it should be formatted, but is less reflective
of the content itself. An option for changing a specific render style, an additional image to display, etc.

enumValues.name: SORTING
enumValues.description:
This property is only used when ordering this entity by ancestors. It should not generally be visible in the frontend, but
remain editable by admins to adjust ordering.

enumValues.name: UNSPECIFIED
enumValues.description:
This property's purpose remains unspecified and is likely the mark of a schema still in development. It should not generally
be in a finished schema, as it is important to help communicate the intent of a property for those building a UI.

types.name: SchemaPropertyKind
types.description:
The _kind_ of a data type for a schema property. Mostly informational
in the API, this value represents the underlying structure of the data type.

enumValues.name: COMPLEX
enumValues.description:
A complex data type that is composed of multiple subproperties
or requires other processing. Their values cannot be easily
mapped to GraphQL / JavaScript primitives.

See `VariableDateProperty`, `FullTextProperty` for examples.

enumValues.name: GROUP
enumValues.description: A composite of other properties. See `GroupProperty`

enumValues.name: REFERENCE
enumValues.description:
A reference (or references) to other models in the system.

See `AssetProperty`, `ContributorsProperty` for examples

enumValues.name: SIMPLE
enumValues.description:
The most common type of property, and what most values are likely to be. Strings,
integers, floats, booleans, and so on.

types.name: SchemaPropertyPath
types.description:
A path to a schema property (it will always be a string primitive).

It can come in the form of a `"single_property"` or a `"nested.property"`.

This scalar is only used to assert the _format_, it does not
validate that it is an existing schema property.

types.name: SchemaPropertyType
types.description: The data type for a schema property.

enumValues.name: ASSET
enumValues.description: A reference to a single asset owned by the schema instance. See `AssetProperty`

enumValues.name: ASSETS
enumValues.description: A reference to multiple assets owned by the schema instance. See `AssetsProperty`

enumValues.name: BOOLEAN
enumValues.description: True or false, yes or no, a checkbox. See `BooleanProperty`

enumValues.name: CONTRIBUTOR
enumValues.description: A reference to a single contributor in the system. See `ContributorProperty`

enumValues.name: CONTRIBUTORS
enumValues.description: A reference to multiple contributors in the system. See `ContributorsProperty`

enumValues.name: DATE
enumValues.description: An ISO8601-formatted date. See `DateProperty`

enumValues.name: EMAIL
enumValues.description: An email address. See `EmailProperty`

enumValues.name: ENTITIES
enumValues.description: A reference to multiple entities. See `EntitiesProperty`

enumValues.name: ENTITY
enumValues.description: A reference to a single entity. See `EntityProperty`

enumValues.name: FLOAT
enumValues.description: A decimal / floating-point number. See `FloatProperty`

enumValues.name: FULL_TEXT
enumValues.description: A complex type representing textual content. See `FullTextProperty`

enumValues.name: GROUP
enumValues.description: A type composed of other properties. See `GroupProperty`

enumValues.name: INTEGER
enumValues.description: A whole number. See `IntegerProperty`

enumValues.name: MARKDOWN
enumValues.description: Markdown-formatted text. See `MarkdownProperty`

enumValues.name: MULTISELECT
enumValues.description: A dropdown that supports selecting multiple values. See `MultiselectProperty`

enumValues.name: SELECT
enumValues.description: A dropdown that can select only one value. See `SelectProperty`

enumValues.name: STRING
enumValues.description: Simple text values. See `StringProperty`

enumValues.name: TAGS
enumValues.description: An array of tags that can be introspected. See `TagsProperty`

enumValues.name: TIMESTAMP
enumValues.description: An ISO8601-formatted timestamp. See `TimestampProperty`

enumValues.name: UNKNOWN
enumValues.description: A fallback type for invalid schemas. See `UnknownProperty`

enumValues.name: URL
enumValues.description: A complex type representing a URL, with metadata. See `URLProperty`

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DATE
enumValues.description: A complex type representing a date that cannot be expressed exactly. See `VariableDateProperty`

args.name: query

Basic quoting and similar features are supported. See
[websearch_to_tsquery](https://www.postgresql.org/docs/13/textsearch-controls.html) for
more information.

facilitating schema validation and errors within the admin application's forms.

Whether to render a field as "wide" (two columns) in the form.
This is intended to help structure forms logically, as well as
provide ample space for certain types of data input, particularly
full-text, markdown, and other such complex fields.

The "short" path for the property. For properties nested within a group, this can

Whether or not this property is required in order for the schema instance
to be considered valid.

Note: invalid data provided to a schema property will still invalidate
the instance as a whole—the required trait only determines whether a value
**must** be set.

fields.name: type

Provided for introspection. This represents the actual data type this property
uses.

Rendering in the frontend should rely primarily on the `AnySchemaProperty` and
`AnyScalarProperty` unions (in that order)`, rather than relying on this value,
since the actual implementations of these properties differ in the GraphQL types
associated with their values.

types.name: TemplateContribution
types.description:
A contribution from a certain contributor.

This is a pared-down version of `Contribution` in order to
better support fragment caching and smaller queries.

It uses `ContributorBase` in place of the `AnyContributor` union.

fields.name: affiliation
fields.description: A potentially-overridden value from person contributors

fields.name: contributionRole
fields.description: The actual role

fields.name: contributor
fields.description: The contributor, loaded via abstract interface for simplicity.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: A potentially-overridden display name value for all contributor types

fields.name: location
fields.description: A potentially-overridden value from organization contributors

fields.name: position
fields.description: An optional sorting discriminator to decide which contribution ranks higher.

fields.name: role
fields.description: An arbitrary text value describing the role the contributor had

fields.name: roleLabel
fields.description: An arbitrary text value describing the role the contributor had

fields.name: title
fields.description: A potentially-overridden value from person contributors

types.name: TemplateContributionList
types.description:
`ContributorListTemplateInstance`s return an ordered list of contributions to render
within as part of their content.

fields.name: contributions
fields.description:
The actual entity records within this list.

The order is deterministic.

fields.name: count
fields.description: The size of the list.

fields.name: empty
fields.description: Whether the list is empty, provided for easier filtering and render-skipping.

types.name: TemplateDefinition
types.description:
Entities within the system have templates associated with schema-specific layouts,
that can be overridden within the hierarchy for more custom approaches.

This interface defines the *definition* for one such template and `layoutDefinition`,
which controls how associated `TemplateInstance`s are rendered.

types.name: TemplateEntityList
types.description:
Some template instances return an ordered list of entities to render
within as part of their content.

This provides access to that list, as well as a shortcut to each entity's
associated `ListItemLayoutInstance`.

**note** It's possible that entities could match the parameters of the list
but be skipped because they have no layouts (yet). This is intentional behavior,
and subsequent fetches should see the list populated as soon as the descendant
entities layouts have rendered.

fields.name: count
fields.description: The size of the list.

fields.name: empty
fields.description: Whether the list is empty, provided for easier filtering and render-skipping.

fields.name: entities
fields.description:
The actual entity records within this list.

The order is deterministic.

fields.name: fallback
fields.description:
Whether the entity selection tried to use the fallback selection mode.

When true, the resulting list is fallback. It can still be empty.

fields.name: listItemLayouts
fields.description:
A shortcut to access the list item layouts for each entity in `entities`.

The order is deterministic.

See `ListItemLayoutInstance`.

types.name: TemplateHasContributionList
types.description: An interface for a template instance that has a `TemplateContributionList`.

fields.name: contributionList
fields.description: The list of contributions to render as part of this template's content.

types.name: TemplateHasEntityList
types.description: An interface for a template instance that has a `TemplateEntityList`.

fields.name: entityList
fields.description: The list of entities to render as part of this template's content.

in order to to link to see all associated records.

fields.name: seeAllOrdering
fields.description: The ordering to render for a "see all" link.

fields.name: entity
fields.description: The associated entity for this template instance.

fields.description:
Whether this template instance should be hidden based on some logic.

At present, this only occurs if certain slots are empty.

types.name: TemplateKind
types.description:
Discriminator for the various types of templates available to an entity,
based on its schema.

enumValues.name: BLURB
enumValues.description:
An arbitrary text blurb that can be used for describing citations or other
runs of content that don't neatly fit within the prescribed hierarchies.

Contained within the `MAIN` layout

enumValues.name: CONTRIBUTOR_LIST
enumValues.description:
A template for listing contributors of note on the main layout of an entity.

Contained within the `MAIN` layout.

enumValues.name: DESCENDANT_LIST
enumValues.description:
A template for rendering descendants of an entity on its main layout,
e.g. a journal listing some recent issues or a series listing featured papers.

Contained within the `MAIN` layout.

enumValues.name: DETAIL
enumValues.description:
Describes details about an entity, its summary, etc.

Contained within the `MAIN` layout.

enumValues.name: HERO
enumValues.description:
A template for describing how an entity's header / hero should look.

Contained within the `HERO` layout.

enumValues.name: LINK_LIST
enumValues.description:
A template for listing entity links on the main layout of an entity.

Contained within the `MAIN` layout.

enumValues.name: LIST_ITEM
enumValues.description:
A template for describing how an entity should appear when rendered in a list.

Contained within the `LIST_ITEM` layout.

enumValues.name: METADATA
enumValues.description:
A template for describing how an entity's metadata should be displayed.

Contained within the `METADATA` layout.

enumValues.name: NAVIGATION
enumValues.description:
This controls the various tabs available to an entity when rendering
its `MAIN`, `METADATA`, `SUPPLEMENTARY` routes.

Contained within the `NAVIGATION` layout.

enumValues.name: ORDERING
enumValues.description:
For applicable entities, allows navigating through specific orderings,
e.g. going back and forth between articles in a specific issue.

Contained within the `MAIN` layout.

enumValues.name: PAGE_LIST
enumValues.description:
A template for listing pages on the main layout of an entity.

Contained within the `MAIN` layout.

enumValues.name: SUPPLEMENTARY
enumValues.description:
A template for describing how an entity's supplementary pages (contributors, metrics)
should render.

Contained within the `SUPPLEMENTARY` layout.

types.name: TemplateOrderingPair
types.description:
An object that provides a next/prev pair for navigating through ordering siblings
within a template.

fields.name: count
fields.description: The number of entries in the ordering (`null` if no match).

fields.name: exists
fields.description:
Whether or not the ordering / entry actually exists and has siblings—can be used to skip rendering.

Implies `inOrdering && !only`.

fields.name: first
fields.description: Whether the source entity is the _first_ entity in the ordering.

fields.name: inOrdering
fields.description: Whether or not the entity is present in the associated ordering / entry.

fields.name: last
fields.description: Whether the source entity is the _last_ entity in the ordering.

fields.name: nextSibling
fields.description: The next entry in the current ordering, if one exists. This will be null if this entry is the last.

fields.name: only
fields.description:
Whether the source entity is the _only_ entity in the ordering.

Implies `first && last`.

fields.name: position
fields.description: The source entity's (1-based) position in the ordering.

fields.name: prevSibling
fields.description: The previous entry in the current ordering, if one exists. This will be null if this entry is the first.

types.name: TemplateSelectionSource
types.description:
A string primitive that represents a selection source for a template definition.

It is used to resolve ordered lists of entities for a given template.

Values can be things like `"self"` or `ancestors.${name}`, where `name` is the
associated ancestor name defined in the originating entity's schema.

```
(?x-mi:\A
    (?:(?-mix:\Aself\z))
    |
    (?:(?-mix:\Aparent\z))
    |
    (?:(?x-mi:
    ancestors
    \.
    (?<ancestor_name>[a-z][a-z0-9_]*[a-z])
    ))
    \z
    )
```

types.name: TemplateSlotBlockDefinition
types.description:
A definition for a block-type template slot.

Its `kind` will always be `BLOCK`.

fields.name: hideWhenEmpty
fields.description:
Whether this slot should cause its parent template to be marked as `hidden`
if it ends up rendering empty.

fields.description: Any errors for this slot that occurred during rendering, if applicable.

fields.description:
Whether this slot should cause its parent template to hide.

**Note**: This is exposed for introspection, but does not need
to be checked on the frontend. Defer to `TemplateInstance.hidden`.

fields.description: The kind of slot instance this is.

fields.name: valid

fields.description: The description of the error.

types.name: TemplateSlotKind
types.description: An enum discriminating between different types of content.

enumValues.name: BLOCK
enumValues.description: A template slot containing lengthier content that may wrap, contain semantic newlines / paragraphs, etc.

enumValues.name: INLINE
enumValues.description:
A template slot containing only inline information. It should contain no block level tags.

It is intended for use in header, list item, and generally any other short-form spans of content.

types.name: TemplateWidth
types.description: An enumerated value associated with the templating subsystem.

enumValues.name: FULL
enumValues.description: This template should occupy the full-width of the layout.

enumValues.name: HALF
enumValues.description:
This template should occupy half of the width of the layout.

**Note**: This should be used in concert with an adjacent HALF-width template.
The server will not validate this is the case.

types.name: TreeNodeFilter
types.description: When retrieving a paginated connection of tree-like entities, this enum is used to delineate which class of nodes to retrieve. Usually, you only want roots, but two other possibilities are exposed.

enumValues.name: LEAVES_ONLY
enumValues.description: Fetch only nodes that are "leaves"; nodes that have a parent of the same type

enumValues.name: ROOTS_AND_LEAVES
enumValues.description: Fetch all nodes that match other filters passed to the resolver

enumValues.name: ROOTS_ONLY
enumValues.description: Fetch only nodes that are "roots": nodes that do not have a parent of the same type
